definition[0]: to close or fasten something firmly by turning it
example[1]: I’d put the new tyre on, but I hadn’t tightened up the wheel.
definition[1]: if you tighten a rope, wire etc, or if it tightens, it is stretched or pulled so that it becomes tight
example[2]: When you tighten guitar strings, the note gets higher.
example[3]: The rope tightened around his body.
definition[2]: to become stiff or make a part of your body become stiff
example[4]: His mouth tightened into a thin, angry line.
example[5]: Tighten up the muscles of both arms.
definition[3]: to make a rule, law, or system more strict
example[6]: Efforts to tighten the rules have failed.
example[7]: a range of measures to tighten up on illegal share dealing
definition[4]: if a race or competition tightens, the distance between the competitors becomes smaller
example[8]: He expects the presidential race to tighten.
